name: Automatiser la collecte de documents de recherche avec Bright Data et n8n
description:
#

## Description

Ce flux de travail collecte et organise automatiquement des documents de recherche à partir de bases de données académiques et de revues dans Google Sheets. Il aide les chercheurs et les étudiants à gagner du temps en éliminant les recherches manuelles à travers plusieurs sources académiques et en centralisant les matériaux de recherche.

## Aperçu

Ce flux de travail extrait automatiquement des documents de recherche à partir de bases de données académiques et de revues, puis les organise dans Google Sheets. Il utilise Bright Data pour accéder aux sources académiques et extrait des informations clés telles que les titres, les auteurs, les résumés et les citations.

### Outils Utilisés

*   **n8n :** La plateforme d'automatisation qui orchestre le flux de travail.
*   **Bright Data :** Pour extraire des sites Web académiques et des bases de données de recherche sans être bloqué.
*   **Google Sheets :** Pour organiser et stocker les données des documents de recherche.

## Comment Installer

1.  **Importer le Flux de Travail :** Téléchargez le fichier `.json` et importez-le dans votre instance n8n.
2.  **Configurer Bright Data :** Ajoutez vos identifiants Bright Data au nœud Bright Data.
3.  **Connecter Google Sheets :** Authentifiez votre compte Google.
4.  **Personnaliser :** Spécifiez les sujets de recherche, les revues ou les auteurs à suivre.

## Cas d'Utilisation

*   **Chercheurs Académiques :** Restez informé des nouveaux documents dans votre domaine.
*   **Étudiants :** Collectez des recherches pour des revues de littérature et des thèses.
*   **Équipes de Recherche :** Collaborez sur des bases de données de littérature.

---

## Connectez-vous avec Moi

*   **Site Web :** [https://www.nofluff.online](https://www.nofluff.online)
*   **YouTube :** [https://www.youtube.com/@YaronBeen/videos](https://www.youtube.com/@YaronBeen/videos)
*   **LinkedIn :** [https://www.linkedin.com/in/yaronbeen/](https://www.linkedin.com/in/yaronbeen/)
*   **Obtenez Bright Data :** [https://get.brightdata.com/1tndi4600b25](https://get.brightdata.com/1tndi4600b25) (Utiliser ce lien soutient mes flux de travail gratuits avec une petite commission)

#n8n #automatisation #recherche #documentsacadémiques #brightdata #googlesheets #documentsderecherche #rechercheacadémique #recherchebibliographique #articlescientifiques #fluxdetravailn8n #fluxdetravail #nocode #automatisationderecherche #extractionacadémique #outilsderecherche #suividesdocuments #revuesacadémiques #basesdedonnéesderecherche #revuebibliographique #écritureacadémique #extractiondedonnées #organisationderecherche #rechercheacadémique #gestiondescitations #productivitéacadémique

nodes.name: Send Request to Bright Data API
Extract Data from HTML (Title, Author, etc.)

parameters.content:
## 🔹 **Section 1: User Input & Trigger**

**🧩 Nodes: Start Scraping | Set Topic**
📍 **Purpose:** Let users easily input the topic they want to scrape — no need to deal with complex URLs.

| 🧱 Node   | ✅ New Name                   | 💡 Description                                                                                                                                                                         |
| --------- | ---------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| ⚡ Trigger | **Start Scraping (Manual)**  | This node starts the workflow when you click “Execute Workflow.” It's the entry point.                                                                                                 |
| ✏️ Set    | **Set Topic (Manual Input)** | Instead of requiring a URL, the user will enter a topic (like "machine learning" or "digital marketing"). This topic will be used to automatically generate the URL behind the scenes. |

### 🧠 How it helps:

* Great for beginners: Just type the topic, hit run.
* Keeps the interface clean and user-friendly.
* Avoids confusion around URLs and formats.

---

## 🔸 **Section 2: Scrape & Parse Website**

**🧩 Nodes: Send Request | Extract HTML | Clean Data**
📍 **Purpose:** Uses the Bright Data proxy to access the webpage, extract raw HTML content, and clean it up into a readable format (title, author, abstract, etc.).

| 🧱 Node         | ✅ New Name                            | 💡 Description                                                                                                                                                        |
| --------------- | ------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| 🌐 HTTP Request | **Send Topic Request to Bright Data** | This sends a request to the Bright Data API using the topic you set earlier. It uses Bright Data’s network to safely load the actual website and return HTML content. |
| 🧱 HTML Extract | **Extract Data from Webpage**         | Parses the returned HTML to find relevant data like titles, authors, abstracts, and links.                                                                            |
| 🔣 Code         | **Clean and Format Scraped Data**     | A custom code block that organizes the messy data into neat records. For example: title → column A, abstract → column B, etc.                                         |

### 🧠 How it helps:

* Makes web scraping safe and reliable by using proxies.
* Converts unreadable HTML into structured information.
* Beginner-friendly: No need to write a parser yourself.

---

## 🟢 **Section 3: Save to Google Sheets**

**🧩 Node: Append to Google Sheets**
📍 **Purpose:** Automatically sends the clean data into a Google Sheet for easy access, filtering, or sharing.

| 🧱 Node          | ✅ New Name                            | 💡 Description                                                                                                                      |
| ---------------- | ------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| 📄 Google Sheets | **Store Scraped Data in Spreadsheet** | Takes the structured output and appends it to the connected Google Sheet. Each result gets a row with title, author, abstract, etc. |

### 🧠 How it helps:

* No manual copy-pasting ever again!
* Shareable and searchable format.
* Updates automatically as you scrape more topics.

---

=======================================
            WORKFLOW ASSISTANCE
=======================================
For any questions or support, please contact:
    Yaron@nofluff.online

Explore more tips and tutorials here:
   - YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@YaronBeen/videos
   - LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/yaronbeen/
=======================================

## 🌟 Research Paper Scraper to Google Sheets

**Automate extraction of data from any website based on a topic — no coding needed!**

---

## 🔹 **Section 1: User Input & Trigger**

**🧩 Nodes: Start Scraping | Set Topic**
📍 **Purpose:** Let users easily input the topic they want to scrape — no need to deal with complex URLs.

| 🧱 Node   | ✅ New Name                   | 💡 Description                                                                                                                                                                         |
| --------- | ---------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| ⚡ Trigger | **Start Scraping (Manual)**  | This node starts the workflow when you click “Execute Workflow.” It's the entry point.                                                                                                 |
| ✏️ Set    | **Set Topic (Manual Input)** | Instead of requiring a URL, the user will enter a topic (like "machine learning" or "digital marketing"). This topic will be used to automatically generate the URL behind the scenes. |

### 🧠 How it helps:

* Great for beginners: Just type the topic, hit run.
* Keeps the interface clean and user-friendly.
* Avoids confusion around URLs and formats.

---

## 🔸 **Section 2: Scrape & Parse Website**

**🧩 Nodes: Send Request | Extract HTML | Clean Data**
📍 **Purpose:** Uses the Bright Data proxy to access the webpage, extract raw HTML content, and clean it up into a readable format (title, author, abstract, etc.).

| 🧱 Node         | ✅ New Name                            | 💡 Description                                                                                                                                                        |
| --------------- | ------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| 🌐 HTTP Request | **Send Topic Request to Bright Data** | This sends a request to the Bright Data API using the topic you set earlier. It uses Bright Data’s network to safely load the actual website and return HTML content. |
| 🧱 HTML Extract | **Extract Data from Webpage**         | Parses the returned HTML to find relevant data like titles, authors, abstracts, and links.                                                                            |
| 🔣 Code         | **Clean and Format Scraped Data**     | A custom code block that organizes the messy data into neat records. For example: title → column A, abstract → column B, etc.                                         |

### 🧠 How it helps:

* Makes web scraping safe and reliable by using proxies.
* Converts unreadable HTML into structured information.
* Beginner-friendly: No need to write a parser yourself.

---

## 🟢 **Section 3: Save to Google Sheets**

**🧩 Node: Append to Google Sheets**
📍 **Purpose:** Automatically sends the clean data into a Google Sheet for easy access, filtering, or sharing.

| 🧱 Node          | ✅ New Name                            | 💡 Description                                                                                                                      |
| ---------------- | ------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| 📄 Google Sheets | **Store Scraped Data in Spreadsheet** | Takes the structured output and appends it to the connected Google Sheet. Each result gets a row with title, author, abstract, etc. |

### 🧠 How it helps:

* No manual copy-pasting ever again!
* Shareable and searchable format.
* Updates automatically as you scrape more topics.

---

## ✅ What a Beginner Gains from This Workflow

| 💡 Feature                  | 🚀 Benefit                                                                        |
| --------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Topic-based input           | You don’t need to find or understand complex URLs. Just type “AI” or “marketing.” |
| Fully automated scraping    | You don’t need to open browsers or inspect elements.                              |
| Ready-to-use Google Sheet   | The final data is clean and saved into a sheet you can use anywhere.              |
| Beautiful, modular workflow | Each step is visual, editable, and reusable without coding skills.                |

---

## 🎯 Final Result:

You type a **topic** → Bright Data scrapes the web → It extracts content → Cleans it → Saves it into **Google Sheets**.
Everything happens automatically. **No code. No hassle. Just data.**

---

## I’ll receive a tiny commission if you join Bright Data through this link—thanks for fueling more free content!

### https://get.brightdata.com/1tndi4600b25
